title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
In the UK in the period January to December (FY) 2025:

Box office revenue was £997 million, up 2% on 2024 and down 21% on 2019.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
There were 124 million cinema admissions, down 2% on 2024 and down 30% on 2019.
Figures are for all films on release, including event releases and those that started their release prior to the FY period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
July recorded 2025’s highest monthly admissions, at 13 million.
Jurassic World Rebirth and Superman were the highest earning releases of that month.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
At the UK and Republic of Ireland (ROI) box office:

Revenue for films released in FY 2025 was £1.0 billion, unchanged from 2024 and down 21% on 2019.
This excludes event releases.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: The total market share of all UK qualifying films was 40.5%, almost 1 percentage point higher than 2024’s UK qualifying share.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
In the UK, in the 12 months to December 2025:

The combined total spend on film and high-end television (HETV) production was £6.8 billion.
This graph shows the figures that were ‘first reported’ for production spend in each 12-month period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
Production data is revised every period to account for lags in obtaining complete data across all types of productions.
Combined spend for the 12 months to December 2025 was up 13% on revised figures for the previous 12-month period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: HETV accounted for 59% of UK production spend in the 12 months to December 2025.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: UK spend on film production was £2.8 billion, up 23% compared with revised figures for the 12 months ending December 2024.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
The BFI assigns productions to one of three categories:

Inward investment features (INW)
Domestic UK features (DOM)
Co-productions (COP)

See notes to statistics releases for full definitions.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: UK spend on HETV projects was £4.0 billion in the 12 months to December 2025, up 7% on revised figures for the previous 12-month period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: Spend on all categories of production increased compared with revised figures for the 12 months to December 2024.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
In the UK, in the 12 months to December 2025:

Combined production starts were down 3% on first reported figures for the 12 months to December 2024.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: Production count for the 12 months to December 2025 is lower than for the other periods shown here. However, as previously noted, figures are likely to be revised upward in subsequent statistical releases as more data becomes available.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: We saw earlier that HETV accounted for the majority of UK production spend in the 12 months to December 2025. In terms of number of productions, however, film accounted for the majority: 53%.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: 193 films were recorded as starting principal photography in the UK in the 12 months to December 2025.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: Lags in obtaining complete data on production activity tend to disproportionately affect counts for domestic UK feature films (DOM), particularly those with budgets of less than £500,000.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: 168 HETV programmes were recorded as starting principal photography in the UK in the 12 months to December 2025.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: HETV programme starts in the 12 months to September 2025 included 14 feature-length single episode productions.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
In the 12 months to December 2025:

A total of 613 films received final certification, either under the cultural test or as an official co-production.
Certification is required to access UK tax reliefs and credits for audiovisual and video game expenditure.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
Films achieving final certification in the 12 months to December 2025 had an associated UK production spend of £2.4 billion.
Films and other productions can apply for final certification when they have completed production and are ready to be released.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
248 HETV titles received final certification through the cultural test in the 12 months to December 2025.
There were two co-productions with final certification but details are not included for disclosure control reasons.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: HETV productions receiving final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to December 2025 had a UK production spend of £4.3 billion.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
74 animation television programmes received final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to December 2025.
There were two co-productions with final certification but details are not included for disclosure control reasons.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: Animation TV productions receiving final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to December 2025 had a UK production spend of £201 million.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
86 children’s television programmes received final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to December 2025.
There were two co-productions with final certification but details are not included for disclosure control reasons.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text: Children’s TV productions receiving final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to December 2025 had a UK production spend of £199 million.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
273 video games received final certification in the 12 months to December 2025.
Video games can only be certified under the cultural test.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to December 2025
text:
Video games receiving final certification in the 12 months to December 2025 had a UK production spend of £618 million.
This is the third highest UK spend figure on record.
